result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry T Minor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 8:34 a.m. Defendant Terry T Minor in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sheets makes an argument for his recommendation.
from Attorney Sheets to reschedule jury trial.
Jury trial - 12 person on April 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person at 03-30-2016 08:30 am
and inspection
Defendant Terry T Minor in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Terry T Minor in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matthew Cornette sworn in.  Testifies he is an officer with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. Testifies to responding to incident involving defendant. Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. 
Cross by Attorney Sheets. Testifies to time of incident. 
Redirect by Attorney Grode. 
Recross by Attorney Sheets. 
Attorney Sheets makes argument. 
Probable cause found.  Arraignment scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 01-19-2016 10:00 am
from Atty Sheets requesting to reschedule Arraignment date and to set the matter for a new Preliminary Hearing date.

3:21 Defendant Terry T Minor in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant quashed.  Court questions Minor regarding his appearance without counsel.  Minor has talked with Atty Eric Sheets.  Court will proceed with Preliminary Hearing.  

Matthew Cornette is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to his employment with Wis Rapids Police Dept.  Testifies to being dispatched to Pizza Hut for a counterfeit bill complaint on 08/06/15.  Testifies to talking with delivery person and what she indicated regarding transaction.  Examined $20 dollar bills and indicates his observations.  Went to address and encountered Terry Minor.  Identifies Terry Minor in the courtroom.  

Court finds probable cause.  Matter is bound over for Arraignment. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
3:16 Defendant Terry T Minor not in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests a warrant.  Court orders a warrant - Body Only.
